ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: In class, students read directly from the original text which exposes them to classical Arabic, helping to develop strong reading skills through practice. The class engages in useful conversations about the text and students work together with the Professor to comment on and discuss the difficult passages and concepts introduced in the Sufi tradition. The course helps one to develop a good understanding of Sufism and allows students to engage in conversation, exchange ideas, and share opinions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was a pleasure to take. I personally enjoyed combing through the Arabic text every week. It could be nice to vary the texts read.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I highly recommend this course for advanced students of Arabic who are interested in the subject. The course is focused on Sufism. it does not deviate from the text which helps students achieve a good understanding of the subject. Professors often assign an unreasonable amount of reading which leaves students overwhelmed, and as a result, students walk away with less from a course. In this class, you will read every sentence with the Professor and students, and this method, I believe, has a greater impact on the learning process.
It depends what they study. If they want to learn about Sufism, then yes since it familiarizes the student with Sufi vocabulary and thought.
